events.name: On-going: Functional Programming in Scala Coursera Study Group
events.description: Study group for the Coursera Functional Programming in Scala Specialization, and all of it's courses.  Anyone may attend regardless of your progress in the courses.  We're here to help. If you have not already, please make sure that you have signed up for the courses you are interested in, on Coursera. <a>Functional Programming in Scala5-course Specialization·École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne</a> It's a good idea to have your development environment set up, before attending.  You can find instructions within the courses themselves.
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Maish Nichani
events.description: Hello everyone! The fifth instalment of the Design Leader meetup series and this time round we'll be having a conversation with Maish Nichani, who leads the team at PebbleRoad, a design consultancy focusing on designing meaningful, innovative digital products and services.  About Maish Maish is a well-respected thought leader and a practitioner in the field of user experience design. He has been an active member of the design community since 2000, having spoken at international conferences, held workshops, written articles and even contributed two books on design.  At PebbleRoad, Maish focuses on building a culture of innovation. He has a Master’s in Instructional Design from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. Agenda for the night 7pm – 7.30pm: Registration and networking 7.30pm – 8.30pm: Conversation with Maish  8.30pm – 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. The value of the meetup is as good as the questions asked :) Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at kiat@ixda.sg and I'll ask them on your behalf :) Alternatively, you may like to tweet us the questions to @IxDASG and we can have that answered! A BIG thanks to our sponsors: IDA Labs@NDC for sponsoring the venue, PebbleRoad and Hired.com for sponsoring the food and drinks.
events.location: IDA Lab @ National Design Center , #03-04 111 Middle Road, Singapore

events.name: talk.js
events.description:
Highlights 7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over pizzas and drinks 7.30pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.40pm: Start of scheduled talks 8.45pm: Open mic announcements 9.00pm: End of event 


Scheduled talks - Performance implications of using the special arguments variable - Jan Hecking - Declarative vs Imperative Programming - Chris Boesch - Encouraging Kids to Code - Shannon Boesch - You! ;) - If you are interested in giving a talk, ping us on our Gitter channel! 


Misc If you have a short announcement you'd like to share with the audience, you may do so during open mic announcements. Remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security. Sponsor(s) Venue sponsor: PayPal Food and drink sponsor: PayPal
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: Singapore Magento User Group Meetup - Aug 2016
events.description: Date: Thursday, 25 Aug 2016 Venue: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina BoulevardLevel 22,[masked], SingaporeTime: 7:00 - 9:00PM Agenda:  1. Magento in the Global Commerce Market and our Unique Differentiators by Mike Doyle and Outi Greve:  Magento is the leading provider of open omnichannel innovation. The open source, cloud-based digital commerce platform and omnichannel solutions empower merchants to integrate digital and physical shopping experiences. Mike Doyle, Enterprise Sales Manager in Magento Commerce for South East Asia, Australia and New Zealand :Mike has over 10 years of experience in the eCommerce and Order Management industry with 5+ years at Magento. While at Magento, Mike has worked with over 400 clients on their migration to the Magento Digital Platform and is a Magento Certified Solution Consultant.https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelscottdoyle Outi Greve, Channel Sales Leader in Magento Commerce for APAC :Outi has over 15 years of experience in the eCommerce industry and strategic alliances.  Outi joined Magento 2 years ago and is responsible for managing partner relationships in Asia Pacific that leverage Magento Enterprise Edition for building profitable online businesses. https://www.linkedin.com/in/outi-greve-051142  2. Mobile focused by Monica Acree In 2015, over 35% of all online traffic took place on smartphone, creating new opportunities and categories for commerce. The world has gone mobile and if your business isn’t optimised for it, you’re getting left behind.  We power some of the worlds leading mobile disruptors like Uber, AirBnB and Hotel Tonight.  Come hear from Monica Acree, Head of Business Development for Braintree APAC, on how mobilising your payments can globalise your business. Monica Acree, Business Development, APAC for Braintree Payments, a PayPal company.As Head of Business Development, Monica is focused on expanding the Braintree footprint in Asia. She is obsessed with User Experience and spends most of her time advocating for friction-free payments experiences. She believes that the future of payments in Asia is mobile and social focused. And she is excited about projects that are making it easier to pay through emerging payment technologies such as 'contextual commerce' and 'invisible payments'.https://www.linkedin.com/in/monicaacree  3. Migration from Magento Community to Enterprise by Sushma Vyas and Ankit Agarwal: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sushmavyashttps://www.linkedin.com/in/ankit-agarwal-2160372b Pizza and drink are sponsor by Microsoft Singapore.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, 018989, Singapore
